title: Emily Atack feels responsibility to be open about depression battle
text:
Emily Atack revealed she turned to medication to help her through a tough time in her life (Picture: ITV/Rex; WireImage)

Emily Atack has opened up about turning to antidepressants to cope with an ‘incredibly tough time’, but vows to be honest in order to help her fans.

The Inbetweeners star and I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here 2018 runner up revealed she was prescribed medication to help her through an ‘incredibly tough time’ but is now using therapy to work on her depression.

The actor, 29, revealed to OK: ‘I’m med-free now. I used medication to get me out of bed in the morning during an incredibly tough time and to dry up my tears, but I’m not in that place any more.

‘I was on them for three years on the advice of my doctor rather than my therapist. But I’m stronger now and the therapy has given me tools to cope with what life throws at me.

‘But I definitely still have days where I struggle to get out of bed. Doesn’t everyone?’

While Emily – who has been confirmed as a presenter on I’m A Celebrity… Extra Camp, may come across as happy and confident on screen, she revealed her darker moments tend to happened when she is on her own rather than around other people.

She explained: ‘Often the most charismatic people have the worst internal struggles. If we don’t find a way to laugh at our problems then we’ll cry.

Emily came runner up in I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here last year and will return to present Extra Camp in the next series (Picture: Rex Features)

‘When I meet people and show the bubbly side to my character, I’m not lying about how I’m feeling.

‘I don’t feel depressed all the time but it sometimes comes on when I’m by myself. As someone with a platform I feel a big responsibility to be open about it.’

She admitted she wrote her Talk Thirty To Me stand-up show in order to be able to laugh at herself along with the audience, and share her experiences.

Emily also recently went through a break-up from boyfriend Rob Jowers following six months of dating, with sources claiming the split was a mutual decision.
